Name: Norwegian Legion
Description:
Experience the exceptional craftsmanship of our 6Ã—50 Connecticut Broadleaf cigar meticulously wrapped around a Nicaraguan binder and Dominican fillers. This special edition cigar was created to represent our country in Norway by the renowned Mr. Guillermo Pena who hails from a lineage of Cuban masters and owns his own factory in Esteli Nicaragua.

Limited Quantity: Selling fast Only 1000 available.
Special Features: Includes a short documentary to watch while smoking.
Premium Quality: Made with Connecticut Broad Leaf.
Exclusive Event: Originally made for Norway now available for you.
Live Smoking Session: Join me on Thursday July 11th at 8pm to smoke it together.
Unmatched Effort: Does anyone else put this much effort into cigars?
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Uncle Paulie's Deli Robusto Aged 2+ Years
Description:
Uncle Paulie's Deli AKA The Good Morning

YO! Let me take you to the hottest city in the country right now: Los Angeles. EVERYONE who is anyone in fashion, film, tech, art, music or design wants to be in LA. Even iconic New Yorkers such as D-nice, Jay-Z and Casey Neistadt are switching teams and moving west. Now let me tell you about Mr. Jon Buscemi. Jon grew up in Long Island New York, skateboarding and listening to hip hop. He is a fellow sneaker collector. He HUSTLES HARD! And after a stint at being a stock broker, he decided it wasn't for him and he ended up working as a creative in fashion and eyewear for some very iconic brands. He is Italian through and through, and incredibly down to earth and sweet. After building his name and network in the fashion world, he started his own sneaker company called BUSCEMI and became wildly successful. He, like the aforementioned, moved to Los Angeles a few years ago. After surveying the food scene, he decided LA is missing a good Italian NY style deli. He called his cousin Paulie in Queens and the rest is history. Bringing a modern take on the old school Italian deli, the pair created Uncle Paulie's Deli.

https://unclepauliesdeli.com

A year later, the who's who of LA's non gluten intolerant movers and shakers often lunch at Uncle Paulie's. Located in the heart of West Hollywood, this is a must eat spot when you visit the City of Angels. Check them out on YouTube for a sneak peak. As for the cigar Oh Boy!! Ya gonna want to sit down for this. Grown, fermented, rolled and aged by the one and only Jochy Blanco. Jochy is a 4th generation tobacco farmer who owns Tobacalera Palma in the Dominican Republic. Like someone off the silver screen, his character emanates swagger and style. Jochy does it his way. Get ready for possibly the best Dominican Connecticut shade cigar you will ever have. Yes, I said that. Wrapper: Dominican Connecticut Hybrid. Binder: Cuban Seed Ligero. Filler: Cuban Seed and Criollo.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Cuban Sandwich Aged 2 years
Description:
These are premium long filler cigars, aged for about two years. Unlike the commonly known short filler cigars referred to as Cuban Sandwiches, ours are affectionately named after the sandwich itself due to their high quality. For more details, check out the video!

The Cuban sandwich and the cigar are both are world-renowned for their authenticity and deep-rooted Cuban traditions. Handcrafted with care, both can be exceptional or disappointing. At Privada Cigar Club, our mission from the start has been to discover and showcase the finest cigars crafted by the most skilled artisans. Our approach is often playful, starting with our popular Philly cheesesteak series which brought joy and satisfaction to many.

We've now tracked down what we believe to be one of the finest Cuban sandwiches ever created and paired it with the perfect cigar, a Habano box-pressed 5 x 54, sun-grown and aged to perfection. Enjoy them together for a symphony of flavors. At Privada Cigar Club, we go further; we even designed a cigar wrapper to resemble a Cuban sandwich, complete with a logo, for a truly unique experience. Can you find experiences like this elsewhere? Join us at Privada Cigar Club to find out! But spoiler, the answer is no.

Crafted by AJ Fernandez at the Tabacalera annex in the heart of Esteli, Nicaragua, this cigar features a sun-grown Habano wrapper, a Brazilian binder, and fillers from Esteli, Condega, and Jalapa.

Name: Montenegro President Gomez Series Aged 3 Years
Description: Montenegro Cigars, a beacon of luxury in the cigar industry, exemplifies the ethos of quality over quantity. Founded by two Beverly Hills investment strategists with a passion for premium cigars, Montenegro stands apart with its commitment to aging and organic farming. With a minimum aging process of 5 years for all tobaccos, and most exceeding 7 years, Montenegro ensures that each cigar is a masterpiece of flavor and craftsmanship. The farm, renowned for being the only known organic tobacco farm in the industry, forgoes pesticides, embracing a natural approach under the guidance of famed Cuban farmer Hector Luis Prieto. This dedication to purity and excellence means Montenegro accepts higher crop losses for unparalleled quality.\n\nThe President Gomez Series, named after the Cuban revolutionary and president, is a testament to Montenegro's commitment to exceptional cigars. Born in Sancti Spa­ritus, the home of the seed for this cigar's wrapper, President Gomez was a figure of controversy and change, mirrored in the bold and revolutionary flavors of this series. This 5.5—55 cigar, despite its extensive aging, retains a juicy character, brimming with intense chocolate notes, making it possibly the most chocolatey cigar to date.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Attribute 7 value(s): Montenegro Grown Corojo and Jalapa Grown Criollo

Name: Cuban Link
Description: Tasting Notes: On the body, what?! Peanut brittle toffee? Whoa. The foot is the same...and the cold draw is vanilla bean, toffee and salted mocha. If the cigar smokes like it tastes and smells, we are in for one heck of a journey. The first third starts with cinnamon, mochas, vanilla, and toffee on the palate, and the retro is a red pepper zing with citrus. Holy moly! Further in the mouth feel is like a buttercream mint you get from a diner with butterscotch. It's sort of like smoking a vanilla mocha latte or something. The second third starts with apple pie flavors. Warmth and coating of the mouth. Cinnamon, artificial hazelnut, more mocha and vanilla. The retro has calmed just a bit but still similar to that amazing zing. In the final third, leather comes into the mix and it tastes like a churro. Sugar, cinnamon, light chocolate frosting, and at the very end I get a smoky peaty note. This is the most dessert notes I have ever gotten in a cigar and I hope your sample smokes as good as mine.\n\nPairing Notes: Coffee, light, and sweet. Mocha anything. Latte. Frappuccino. Any dessert with coffee flavors. Coffee cake. Chocolate porter beers. Wheated bourbon. Scotch. Cognac. Chai Tea. After dessert chocolates. With Nutella.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: The Cuban Link Toro
Description: The Cuban Link by IGM Cigars is a testament to the meticulous craftsmanship of Costa Rican tobacco artisans. Aged for one year, this cigar embodies the elegance and sophistication of the Ecuadorian Connecticut Shade wrapper, coupled with a Costa Rican binder and special filler blend. IGM Cigars has consistently delivered quality, and this offering is no exception. Each puff takes you on a journey through the heart of Costa Rica's tobacco fields, highlighting why this region is celebrated for its cigar production. The Cuban Link is not just a smoke; it's an experience that blends tradition with innovation, offering a rich and rewarding flavor profile.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Santana D'Crossier Interview Cigar
Description:
Santana D'Crossier Interview Cigar

\n\n6 x 52 Golden Habano Wrapper Caresses the Finest Costa Rican Binder and Fillers. The rest is a mystery. This is the same cigar we smoke together in the interview. This is one of the most balanced and beautiful traditional Cuban style cigars. PERFECTION!!

Name: Cremo CT OM Aged 1 Year
Description: Cremo, a storied brand among America's oldest, epitomizes excellence with a deep-rooted presence in the industry. Its commitment to affordability was demonstrated by maintaining cigar prices at five cents well into the 1990s, underscoring its significant history. In the past 14 years, Cremo has undergone a notable transformation at its Miami factory, renowned for its exceptional craftsmanship and employing top-tier Cuban level nine rollers.\n\nAlthough not as renowned as El Titan De Bronze, which previously produced the CREMO line, this factory preserves Cuban tobacco traditions in storage and rolling. The Cremo Connecticut stands out as the pinnacle of American factory-produced cigars, embodying a legacy of quality and traditionâ€”a true testament to a brand's enduring commitment to excellence.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: The Reinier Lorenzo Privada Masterpiece
Description:
Reinier Lorenzo and I have teamed up to create something pretty special for cigar lovers: a pair of cigars that show off how changing the wrapper can make a big difference in taste, even when the inside stuff stays the same. We're inviting members of the Privada Cigar Club and the Limited Cigar Association to dive into a world of flavor, skill, and tradition with us.

First up is the Habano cigar, a real show-stopper made with top-notch Aganorsa tobacco. It's a big one, at 6 1/2Ã—52, and it's HVC's nod to the classic Cuban cigar style, using rich Nicaraguan tobacco for a taste that's all about tradition and quality. Then there's the Maduro version, ready to be discovered by LCA members this month. It's a chance for cigar fans to dig into something new and exciting.

Keep your eyes peeled for Reinier's latest work from his own factory, a big move from Aganorsa. Born in Cuba and now making cigars in Nicaragua, Reinier's talent really shines with Aganorsa's top-quality tobacco, some of the best out there. The real excitement is seeing how these tobaccos will come to life ina new way at his new place.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Attribute 7 value(s): Jalapa Corojo 99 and Corojo 2012 with Criollo 98 from Esteli

Name: Montenegro Serie E Bala (Aged 9 Years)
Description: We have all seen the influx of luxury cigar companies in this industry. I tend to stray away from most of them. Montenegro, however, is one that actually walks the walk. Nothing leaves their factory with less than 5 years of age. Most tobaccos are aged in excess of 7 years. Nothing NEEDS to be sold. This is what happens when two Beverly Hills investment strategists who love cigars buy a farm in Nicaragua.\n\nThe farm is the only organic tobacco farm I know of. They do not use pesticides. This means smaller yields. They also hired famed Cuban tobacco farmer Hector Luis Prieto to run their farm and source their seeds. Not one cigar was sold for the first 7-8 years in business. They don't really seem to care either. The two partners simply want to smoke the best and if the farm and factory break even they are very happy. The quality of the product comes before all else. Based on the feedback we have received on past Montenegro cigars in the club, I'd say it is. Privada members are the top of their client list, which says a lot about what we are doing together.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: 1928 4 Pack
Description: Steamboat immerses enthusiasts in nostalgia, celebrating the public domain admittance of the world's favorite animated character. This release features an ultra-rare Nicaraguan Maduro wrapper, with production limited to only 20,000 cigars. Inside, a double binder of Jalapa corojo and vintage Cuban-seed corojo with Nicaraguan fillers meld to create a rich, complex profile. Blended by Brian Desind, founder of the Privada Cigar Club and the LCA, Steamboat offers a unique celebration of animation history and expert cigar craftsmanship. This limited-edition release is exclusively available through the LCA, providing a distinct, memorable smoke that pays homage to a legendary figure.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Antonio By A.J. Fernandez
Description:
Antonio By A.J. Fernandez

A.J. Fernandez Cigars, with deep roots in San LuÃ­s, Cuba, has made a significant mark in the cigar industry, particularly with the revival of the San Lotano brand, a nod to the legacy left by Abdel Fernandez's grandfather before the Cuban Revolution. The development of Tabacalera Fernandez from a modest facility in Esteli, Nicaragua, into one of the largest cigar producers, underscores a journey of dedication and craftsmanship. A.J. Fernandez has been pivotal in creating renowned blends like Man O'War and Diesel, earning accolades and near cult followings for their distinct profiles. The Antonio is a robust homage to the traditional Cuban robusto, embodying the rich heritage of Cuban cigar making while asserting the superior quality of Nicaraguan craftsmanship. This cigar, named after Ramon Allones' brother Antonio, who co-founded the iconic company, challenges the notion that Cuban cigars are unrivaled. It invites aficionados to experience a blend that rivals, if not surpasses, the nostalgic allure of Cuban cigars with its Nicaraguan flair and Privada Cigar Club's innovative spirit.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Tags: aj fernandez, Antonio, Privada, Privada Cigar Club

Name: Montenegro White PCC Aged 7+ Years
Description: We have all seen the influx of luxury cigar companies in this industry. I tend to stray away from most of them. Montenegro, however, is one that actually walks the walk. Nothing leaves their factory with less than 5 years of age. Most tobaccos are aged in excess of 7 years. Nothing NEEDS to be sold. This is what happens when two Beverly Hills investment strategists who love cigars buy a farm in Nicaragua. The farm is the only organic tobacco farm I actually know of. They do not use pesticides. This means smaller yields. They also hired famed Cuban tobacco farmer Hector Luis Prieto to run their farm and source their seeds. Not one cigar was sold for the first 7-8 years in business. They don't really seem to care either. The two partners simply want to smoke the best and if the farm and factory break even they are very happy. The quality of the product comes before all else. Based on the feedback we have received on past Montenegro cigars in the club, I'd say it is. Privada members are the top of their client list, which says a lot about what we are doing together.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Raspberry Beret Aged 1 Year
Description:
Established in 1995 in Little Havana, Miami, FL, El Titan De Bronze Cigar Mfg. is a beacon of handcrafted cigar excellence. Their Level 9 rollers, with backgrounds in renowned factories like Romeo y Julieta, Corona, and Partagas, craft cigars in the traditional Cuban style, including entubado filler tubing and a distinct triple cap.

Daily tasks undergo a rigorous inspection by a Master Roller/Blender to ensure aficionados get the highest standard. Located in Little Havana on Calle Ocho, El Titan De Bronze embodies the spirit of Havana, Cuba. The factory's namesake, Antonio Maceo Grajales, the Bronze Titan, symbolizes dedication to craftsmanship. Maceo's motto, My duties to country and political convictions are above all human effort, mirrors the factory's commitment to exceptional cigars.

Annually, El Titan De Bronze collaborates with a traditional cigar factory for a limited run. The familial ambiance and content rollers result in magical, collectible masterpieces. Inspired by motifs like Prince's Raspberry Beret, the band design, with pioneering 3D gold foil, adds uniqueness. The exclusive client list, being the last new client accepted by the esteemed factory, highlights the rarity and value of these sought-after collectibles in the cigar world.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Junito Aged 4 Years
Description: Immerse yourself in the world of Cuban-style cigars with our exclusive announcement tailored for both enthusiasts and newcomers. Discover a meticulously crafted Costa Rican cigar from a renowned factory celebrated for its Cuban-style creations, ensuring an authentic and captivating experience.\n\nOriginally destined for a wealthy Spaniard with a prestigious cigar brand, this unique cigar reached us due to dissatisfaction with the wrapper leaf's dry appearance. At Privada Cigar Club, our focus is on the essence of cigars, prioritizing quality over aesthetics, ensuring a remarkable smoking experience. In a departure from themed boxes, this year, we unveil a series of bands that seamlessly blend tradition with a bold statement. These bands, mimicking popular Cuban brands, are designed to engage critics of our artwork. However, the backs of these bands feature a lineup of original characters unique to our club. One such character, inspired by Popeye and boasting distinctive features like striking gold teeth, adds a touch of originality. This collection, a harmonious blend of homage and creativity, invites you to share suggestions for character names at info@privadacigarclub.com. Join us in celebrating this exciting fusion of tradition and innovation in the world of premium cigars!
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Espinosa Cigars Hialeah Gardens Limited Edition Aged 4+ Years
Description: Espinosa Cigars Hialeah Gardens Limited Edition Aged 4+ Years: If you watch our YouTube channel, you already know about Erik Espinosa. A tough, stout, Cuban from the streets. He built a multi-million dollar company out of absolutely nothing except passion and hard work. The American dream. The first time I went to visit Espinosa was the first time I was ever in Hialeah Gardens. Almost all of my cigar shipments come from this area of Hialeah Gardens, Hialeah, and Doral. This is an area outside of downtown Miami that is 100% Cuban. It is like being transported to a different country in South America or the Caribbean.\n\nEspinosa Cigars Hialeah Gardens Limited Edition Aged 4+ Years: I started to think about how every cigar typically has the city name of Havana and Cuba. Then I started to think about the reality of it all. The cigars we smoke pass through this area more than anywhere else in the world. And I thought to myself, why the hell doesn't anyone call their cigar the Hialeah? So I asked Erik and he said why the hell would anyone do that? To which I answered, Because it's the truth. As much as we like to glamorize the old world and tradition, the truth becomes tradition. And the truth is that since about 2001 and beyond, Hialeah and Hialeah gardens have become THE cigar epicenter. Enjoy one of the better cigars you may have all year. Espinosa put everything he had into this blend. There are some cigars that just get all the love, and this is one of those. #weareprivada

Name: Reserva Rojas Aged 2+ Years
Description: So about two years ago, I asked my buddy, Noel Rojas, to make a special cigar for me. I wanted it to taste and feel just like the Cuban Partagas No. 4, which is one of my favorites. After a long and careful process of aging in coolers, I think it's finally ready to be smoked. During these two years, Noel has really started to make a name for himself in the cigar industry, and I like to think that I had a small part in that. We've done some cool stuff together, like making unique blends on our YouTube channel and creating exclusive cigars that people just can't seem to get enough of. One of our big hits was the Peruvian Gold. My goal in working with folks like Noel is to make sure we both benefit from our collaborations. It's all about give and take, right? I believe this approach strengthens relationships and helps us both be more successful in what we do. Now, after all this time and work, I can't wait to sit back and enjoy this special cigar. It's more than just a cigar to me; it's a symbol of the hard work and passion we both put into the art of making cigars.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Champagne Aged 1.5 Years
Description:
Champagne Aged 1.5 Years

Champagne, a symbol of celebration, in its unique, bubbly form, elicits joy even for those who abstain from alcohol. The champagne flutes filled with effervescence create an atmosphere of festivity. Likewise, this cigar stands as a testament to the extraordinary craftsmanship achievable at our modest factory nestled in downtown Esteli, Nicaragua. We have utilized some of the finest tobaccos- aged, fermented, and then further aged post-production using methods time-tested and universally appreciated. Relish every inch of this Maduro and pay special attention to the use of the exceptional sweet and juicy Brazilian Mata Fina tobaccos as binders. The spicy fillers and the sweet woody undertones of the wrapper weave a complex and satisfying taste narrative. In my opinion, this creation is a work of art, one that is destined to improve and flourish with age. With such offerings, Nicaragua is steadily asserting itself as the new Cuba.
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: Aganorsa La Radiante Nacionale Aged 1.5+ Years
Description:
Aganorsa La Radiante Nacionale Aged 1.5+ Years

\n\nYou think you're big time? I can hear Pacino yelling it now. We are big time now. I never mention it but Aganorsa, the LARGEST grower of Cuban Seed tobacco in Nicaragua, loves us. Shout out to Terrence Reilly and the Fernandez Family, as well as Cousin Paul Palmer for hooking us up always. This tobacco is used in Padron, Illusione, formerly My Father and the list goes on. After getting to know this amazing family and company they have allowed us the opportunity to smoke legends. This, my friends, will be one of them, I'm calling it now. Babe Ruth at the plate. WE get the best damn cigars in the game and it shows. This entire box has been composed of Cuban seed premium tobacco grown in the region that has been dubbed the New Cuba, Esteli and surrounding areas of Nicaragua. This is the soil, this is the leaf. The most flavorful all around tobacco the world has to offer right now, and fermented properly too. What else can I say but thank you Aganorsa and we should all be grateful. We have come a long way and still have a long way to go, but it's moments like this when I smoke this and feel like we can celebrate for a moment. From our hard work to your home, enjoy!
Tags: Aganorsa, Aged 1.5+ Years, La Radiante Nacionale, Privada, Privada Cigar Club

Name: DK DUO
Description:
DK DUO

Blanc et Bleu In the late 1990's and early 2000's, the Dominican Republic produced some of the finest and most expensive cigars in the world. Once sought after by collectors and counterfeited by criminals, these blends have become overshadowed in the past decade by cigars that focus on body and strength over nuance and balance. DK provides the opportunity to re-discover the legendary blends and rare tobaccos that once took over the industry. Experience the golden age of what made the Dominican Republic king of cigars. Each DK Duo coffin features two cigars: DK White and DK Blue. DK White comes in at 5x52 featuring an Ecuadorian Habana 2000 wrapper, Dominican San Vicente Seco binder, and Dominican fillers of Piloto Cubano Visus, Habano 2020 Visus, San Vicente Mejorado Seco, and Corojo 99 Seco. DK Blue measures 4x54 and showcases an Ecuadorian Habana 2000 Maduro wrapper, Dominican San Vicente Seco binder, and Dominican fillers of Piloto Cubano Ligero, Habano 92 Visus, San Vicente Mejorado Seco, and Corojo 99 Visus. Both blends were rolled at Tabacalera El Puente in the Dominican Republic.
Tags: DK, DK Duo, Dominican Republic, Robusto, short robusto

Name: Royal Affair By AJ Fernandez (W.A. Collection) Aged 2+ Years
Description:
Royal Affair By AJ Fernandez (W.A. Collection) Aged 2+ Years

\n\nYou have to understand that the term Nicaraguan Puro gets thrown around a lot but often is not completely true. In this case, we are very lucky to have a confirmed Nicaraguan grown and rolled cigar in which most of the tobacco comes from a single estate. This is truly rare. AJ Fernandez has given us another classic Nicaraguan Habano that will take you on a journey to the soul of the country itself. When you smoke this cigar you will not have to wonder why Nicaragua has become the new Cuba in many aspects. Tobacco this naturally flavorful is a phenomenon and should be given your utmost attention.
Tags: Aged 2+ Years, aj fernandez, Privada, Privada Cigar Club, Royal Affair

Name: A.A. Brugger (Remake) Aged 2+ Years
Description:
A.A. Brugger (Remake) Aged 2+ Years

\n\nWell folks, as it turns out our very own Clark Thornton had a great relative who was in the cigar business of Erie, PA about a century ago and into the late 1960s. One day when Clark was visiting relatives in Erie they told him about the brand and shop A.A. Brugger that was owned by his great grandfather. They sold their Pennsylvania-wrapped cigars at 125 W. 24th Street in Erie. The brand was known for its dark Pennsylvania wrapper, later called broadleaf. We tried to replicate the cigar using as much as we could find out about it. So here it is. A Pennsylvania Broadleaf Maduro with a Pennsylvania Broadleaf binder and fillers from Nicaragua, rather than Cuba. I'm sure old Mr. Brugger would be proud of Clark if he could see him today.
Tags: A.A. Brugger, Aged 2+ Years, Privada, Privada Cigar Club

Name: Rojas KSG Red Lonsdale Privada Exclusive Aged 3+ Years
Description:
Rojas KSG Red Lonsdale Privada Exclusive Aged 3+ Years

\n\nNoel Rojas is taking the cigar industry by storm, like it or not. There are a ton of Cuban immigrants in this business, but it is pretty cool to see a one-man show that really has not been here very long take a piece of the market for himself. Watch our interview with him on YouTube. He dodged the law and communism to be here and his cigars are made with a knowledge and spirit of Cuba. Noel is a tobacco philosopher with roots in the old world and branches in the new one. This cigar won awards with the lancero format and Noel wanted Privada members to have a size of their own. KSG stands for King of the Small Gauge. Let's enjoy this cigar together and show our gratitude for SeÃ±or Rojas's work!
Tags: Aged 3+ Years, KSG Red, Lonsdale, Privada, Privada Cigar Club, Privada Exclusive, Rojas

Name: Montenegro President Series Cordial Aged 6+ Years
Description:
Montenegro President Series Cordial Aged 6+ Years

\n\nSo, I found out why Montenegro is so damn good. The Batista we had last year blew the industry away. People could not understand why and how it was so good. And so after some teeth pulling and a few dinners with the owners at the Grand Havana Room in Beverly Hills, it became clear. Hector Luis Prieto. This is one of the best tobacco growers in Cuba to date. He not only helped set up the Montenegro farm (which is organic by the way; no pesticides) 8 years ago, he also brought all of his seeds from Cuba to plant initially. He shows up in Nicaragua twice a year to check on operations. He will first eat the soil. I'm not kidding. When they found the farm, he would walk around tasting the soil. This is how they know where to buy land. Incredible and crazy stuff here, people. This one cigar alone makes this month's box worth the opportunity to smoke it. This is no Batista though, I must tell you. This is a bit zestier. Still has the same perfect construction for the most part, and similar flavors, but this one kicks a bit harder. That's enough story, let's smoke!
Tags: Aged 6 Years, Cordial, Montenegro, Presiden Series, Privada, Privada Cigar Club

Name: Vault Cigars Series 1 Toro
Description:
Vault Cigars Series 1 Toro

\n\nHonduras. Raices Cubanas Farm and Factory. Hugo Sanchez. 25 years in business using traditional Cuban methods. There's no farm or factory like it. I truly believe some of the best cigars in the world come out of this factory. This is the man behind Padilla, Viaje, Alec, Illusioneâ€¦ and the list goes on. All of their best stuff comes from Raices. So it is truly an honor that they have allowed us to raid their vaults. These are the cigars that were forgotten. These are the cigars that were never paid for. These are the resting vampires of this factory. VAULT. Any time you see this cigar brand, BUY IT! No one in the world can get their hands on these right now except you. But at some point, cigars from this brand will be available in stores. Each edition is totally different from the next. But, we have them first! Damn, we are lucky. When I tell you that we may never get a cigar that produces these flavors again, I am not exaggerating. I recommend this for the morning with a vanilla coffee. Something happens to certain cigars during the aging process. And aging at the factory is dog years compared with aging in the states. It's like the age on scotch vs. the age on bourbon. Some aging resonates faster.
Tags: Honduras, Privada, Privada Cigar Club, Series 1, toro, Vault

Description:
#Chargerash by Aladino Aged 3+ Years

\n\nBLESSED. This cigar is a testament to the Eiroa Family. To their Cuban Corojo Leaf. To their farming and factory heritage and practices. The Origin of the Cuban Corojo seed, before the blue mold plagues, is within.
Tags: #Chargerash, Aged 3+ Years, Aladino, Privada, Privada Cigar Club

Name: Montenegro Batista Aged 10+ Years
Description:
Montenegro Batista Aged 10+ Years

\n\nOn the 26th of July, 1953, Fidel Castro invaded Cuba. On December 31, 1958, at a New Year's Eve party, the president of Cuba, Fulgencio Batista, told his cabinet and top officials that he was leaving the country. After seven years, Batista knew his presidency was over, and he fled the island in the early morning. Under Batista, Havana Cuba was the original Las Vegas casino town. It was run by the mob and fueled by gambling and all the things that come with that. There were millions upon millions of dollars coming in and out of Cuba, along with tourists from all over the world. This cigar band is in no way trying to disrespect any of the people who shaped the history of Cuba. This cigar band is simply a what-if. What if Batista had remained in power? The band was created under my art direction along with @sedatedhype. Our concept was Cuba remaining a Las Vegas style resort. Money, power, gambling chips. We wanted to take a traditional style Cuban cigar band like Bolivar and re-work it in the vintage neon casino style. We are in no way saying Cuba should have, or shouldn't have remained under Batista's rule. We are simply asking, what if? Would this be what traditional cigar bands look like? We wanted to put this band on the Montenegro cigar for a few reasons. The first being how classic the blend, style, and flavors of the cigar are. In my opinion, for a traditionalist out of Cuba working with otherworldly tobaccos, with Cuban classics in mind, you will not find a much better blend. The other reason is because of how decadent Montenegro is as a brand. The cigars are expensive. Pure. Traditional. And no expense is spared. I hope you enjoy this experience and maybe it will provoke some thought into the what-if. This is an 8 year aged Nicaraguan puro that was given to us for way less than it typically costs because of the support you offer Montenegro. PLEASE shout them out for this one! @mspcigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Tags: Aged 10+ Years, Batista, Montenegro, Privada, Privada Cigar Club

Name: HVC 500 Limited Edition Short Robusto PCC Exclusive Aged 3+ Years
Description:
HVC 500 Limited Edition Short Robusto PCC Exclusive Aged 3+ Years

Privada Cigar Club Exclusive I have to admit I feel like a boss for this one. According to some, this was the best or at least one of the best cigars of 2019. It won limited cigar of the year. It took home several positions in some of the top 25 lists as well. People went nuts over it. So when Reinier, the owner of HVC, asked if he could produce a short robust for the club, of course I said YES! If you have been in the club a while now you know about Reinier. He's a Cuban born scientist turned cigar maker with the voice of a villain and a heart of gold. Truly the nicest person I've met in this business. He's got a bunch of great cigars in his lineup. But this one? This one right here? This takes the cake. This cigar was developed to commemorate the 500th anniversary of Cuba. So it's no wonder why this cigar is possibly the closest thing to a new world Cuban you could ever find. All the American smokers want this experience when they smoke a Cuban cigar. But most are left wanting more to say the least. It's like a Cuban cigar on steroids. The draw ranges from good to firm but ironically the firmer draw samples I smoked were even more enjoyable. Not typical. Not for me at least. And this size? I mean if there is a top 3 list of sizes for me, the short robusto is on that list. It's enough for a sitting but leaves you wanting more. It's like a weekend getaway versus an entire vacation. Sometimes shorter is just better. Also, the wrapper is extremely DELICATE!!! Only pull the band off when you absolutely have to.
Tags: Aged 3+ Years, HVC 500, Limite Edition, PCC Exclusive, Privada, Privada Cigar Club, short robusto

Name: CLE / Eiroa 2013 Aged 10+ Years Toro
Description:
CLE / Eiroa 2013 Aged 10+ Years Toro

\n\nFirst thing you need to know is the Eiroa family was the first family to grow Cuban seed Corojo tobacco outside of Cuba and from what I understand, the first tobacco farm that grew tobacco for cigars outside of Cuba. This goes back to around 1920. We will interview Christian Eiroa soon and get the breakdown. The Eiroa family owned Camacho cigars before selling to Davidoff in 2008. From what I'm told there was a non-compete agreement of 5 years that needed to be fulfilled until re-entering the cigar industry. That brings us to 2013. The Eiroa family open a new factory called Alladino (you have most likely heard of that brand named after the factory). This is one of two first blends they re-entered the market with. It sold for about a year before legal issues found it sitting in Honduras unable to be sold. This cigar you hold in your hand has been waiting to meet you. It's been in a box lined with cedar in an aging room in Honduras for 10 years. And here it is. Right here in your hands. The thing to know about Honduran Corojo tobacco is it is the original Habano wrapper. Cuba, during the 60's saw a blue mold plague that wiped out crops and caused them to genetically modify or hybrid their tobacco seeds. But this is from the original seed. Isn't that amazing? Damn I love cigars and I love finding you stuff like this even more. This blend was to be their full flavored American market stick so let's check it out. The blend is 100% Honduran Corojo tobacco.
Tags: 2013, Aged 10+ Years, CLE, Eiroa, Privada, Privada Cigar Club, toro

Name: Cigar Chief Black Friday Cigar Bundle
Description:
Cigar Chief Black Friday Cigar Bundle

This Black Friday, elevate your cigar experience with our Premium Cigar Bundle – a curated selection of 8 exceptional cigars, handpicked for their quality, flavor, and craftsmanship. Whether you're a seasoned aficionado or just starting your journey, this bundle offers an incredible opportunity to enjoy some of the finest cigars in the world, all at a price that can’t be beaten.
The Bundle Includes:
  • Escobar Ultra Black Platinum Series – A bold, full-bodied masterpiece that combines rich flavors of cocoa, espresso, and spice with smooth, luxurious notes of dark chocolate and leather. Perfect for the connoisseur who loves a deep, complex smoke.
  • Alec Bradley Coyol Toro – A medium-bodied beauty, with a flavor profile that’s both rich and balanced. Expect notes of sweet spice, cedar, and earthy undertones, making this one an ideal choice for any time of day.
  • Partagas Serie D No. 4 – A legendary Cuban cigar, offering a full-bodied smoking experience with flavors of black pepper, earthy richness, and a touch of sweet cream. A must-have for lovers of bold, flavorful cigars.
  • My Father Flor De Las Antillas Robusto – A rich and aromatic medium to full-bodied smoke with flavors of spice, oak, and coffee, featuring the perfect balance of complexity and smoothness that My Father cigars are known for.
  • Punch London Club – A classic, medium-bodied cigar with rich, woody flavors and a touch of leather. Its traditional design and impeccable craftsmanship offer a perfect example of Punch's commitment to excellence.
  • Paul Stulac Post Script Habano Toro – A full-bodied powerhouse with a spicy kick and notes of leather, coffee, and dark chocolate. Crafted for those who seek bold flavors and a robust smoking experience.
  • AJ Fernandez Last Call Flaquitas Habano Torpedo – A compact yet powerful cigar with rich flavors of earth, coffee, and leather. With its signature habano wrapper and dynamic flavor profile, this one delivers the punch you're looking for in a shorter smoke.
  • Serino Wayfarer Dalia – A smooth, medium-bodied cigar with an elegant flavor profile, featuring notes of cream, toasted nuts, and a hint of citrus. This cigar is a sophisticated choice for those who appreciate refined, mellow smokes.
Why Choose This Bundle?
  • Premium Selection: These 8 cigars represent the pinnacle of quality, from world-renowned brands and master blenders.
  • Unbeatable Value: Get premium cigars at an incredible price—just in time for Black Friday!
  • Versatile Collection: Whether you prefer full-bodied smokes, medium complexity, or smooth, creamy profiles, this bundle has something for every palate.
  • Limited Time Offer: Don't miss out—our Black Friday bundle is a one-time deal, only available while supplies last!
Indulge in the best this Black Friday with a selection that will make every cigar enthusiast's collection shine. Secure your Premium Cigar Bundle today and experience the ultimate in luxury smoking.
Categories: Cigars > Cigar Bundles, Cigars, Cigars > Cuban Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars, Cigars > Samplers
Tags: Black Friday, Bundles, Cigar Chief, Samplers

Name: E.P. Carrillo La Historia El Senador
Description:
E.P. Carrillo La Historia El Senador

  • Size: 5 3/8 x 52
  • Strength: Full
This full-flavored cigar exudes richness and complexity, presenting a harmonious blend of cocoa and coffee undertones that promise to captivate your senses. Its robust and gratifying conclusion leaves a subtle sweetness lingering on the palate, making it an ideal selection for those with a penchant for premium cigars. The well-rounded amalgamation of spice and earthy notes ensures that each draw is a moment to relish, allowing you to fully appreciate the intricate flavor profile of this cigar.

E.P Carrillo La Historia Line

Every cigar tells a story, and La Historia by E.P. Carrillo is a deeply personal narrative of the Perez-Carrillo family, paying homage to the women who have inspired the master blender himself, Ernesto Perez-Carrillo. This exceptional cigar is more than just a blend; it’s a heartfelt tribute to Ernesto’s mother and daughter, depicted on the band, symbolizing the rich heritage and enduring legacy of the Perez-Carrillo family.

The artwork on the band is a poignant representation of Ernesto’s inspirations: his mother in the tobacco fields of Cuba and his daughter in his home of Miami, FL. These images encapsulate the journey of the Perez-Carrillo family from Cuba to the United States, symbolizing resilience, tradition, and the pursuit of excellence.

Boxes of 20 cigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Tags: Dominican Republic, E.P. Carrillo, El Senador, Full, La Historia, nicaragua, toro

Name: Year of the Puff
Description:
Year of the Puff

  • Size: 6 x 54
  • Strength: Medium
In a bold return to excellence, LCA introduces the “Year of Puff,” expertly crafted by the renowned AJ Fernandez in Estelí, Nicaragua. This 6×54 toro features a Cuban-seed, Ecuadorian-grown wrapper aged for over a decade, a three-year-aged binder from Estelí, and fillers personally cultivated by AJ Fernandez, offering an exceptional smoking experience. With its unmatched blend and highly collectible packaging, the “Year of Puff” is set to be one of the top offerings of 2024. Recently rated a 92 by Cigar Public, it is a must-have for aficionados.

Name: CAO Italia Ciao
Description:
CAO Italia Ciao

  • Size: 5 x 56
  • Strength: Medium
CAO Italia, with its medium-bodied, slightly sweet blend, is the cigar that proves that Italy excels at more than wine and pasta. In the Benevento region of Italy, nestled between Rome and Naples, you’ll find a new world of flavour flourishing in the heart of the old world. CAO Italia’s Habano seed was brought to Italy from Cuba nearly fifty years ago and lends a unique and earthy sweetness to this  medium-bodied cigar. CAO Italia proves that Italy can do more than produce some of the world’s finest wines and cuisine – it can produce some bellisimo tobacco as well. Boxes of 20 cigars

Name: Joya de Nicaragua Antano 1970 Cigarillos
Description:
Joya de Nicaragua Antano 1970 Cigarillos

  • Size: 4 x 32
  • Strength: Full
Made exclusively by hand and entirely of Nicaraguan harvested tobaccos. This cigar is an ultra-robust, spicy smoke with an earthy finish, unbridled body and aroma, which showcases the authentic Nicaraguan puro. Antaño in Spanish means ‘Yesteryear’, a word that perfectly expresses the soul of the Joya de Nicaragua Antaño. It was released over 15 years ago as a tribute to the power and the essence of the “The True Nicaraguan Puro” that made Joya de Nicaragua the most sought after cigar in the United States in the 1970’s during the post Cuban embargo. Tins of 10 cigarillos; cartons of 5 tins

Short description: Phenomenal earth and cedar notes endorse the bold, smooth finale.
Description:
La Aroma de Cuba Connecticut El Jefe

  • Size: 7 x 58
  • Strength: Mild-Medium
World-renowned cigar-makers Pepin and Jaime Garcia masterfully unify the finest Nicaraguan long-filler tobaccos under a gorgeous Connecticut-seed wrapper, cultivated in Ecuador, to create La Aroma de Cuba Connecticut. Thriving tobacco crops harvested on Garcia-family estates in Estelí, Jalapa, and Condega undergo a thorough triple fermentation before they’re assembled in seven attractive sizes. Lavish notes of almond, cashew, cedar, and coffee bean mingle with hints of buttercream before a soft finish resonates. Savor the immense talents of the Garcia family in a 92-rated, mellow, and sophisticated classic from the award-winning La Aroma de Cuba portfolio today.

About La Aroma De Cuba Cigars

An original Cuban brand from the late 1800s, La Aroma de Cuba has been reborn in the house of legendary cigar-maker, Jose “Pepin” Garcia, in Estelí, Nicaragua.  In the wake of its revival, La Aroma de Cuba is now a burgeoning enterprise synonymous with quality and value.  Precision blending of the finest, aged Nicaraguan tobaccos provides a consistent mild-medium bodied profile.   Boxes of 24 cigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Tags: Ecuadorian Connecticut, Gordo, La Aroma de Cuba, Medium, nicaragua

La Aroma de Cuba Robusto

  • Size: 5 1/4 x 54

The original La Aroma de Cuba blend is drawn from a premium recipe of well-aged Nicaraguan binder and filler tobaccos patiently assembled beneath a shimmering Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper. A phenomenal, medium-bodied profile of cocoa, cedar, molasses, and earth layers the palate with subtle distinction in several classic sizes. Indulge in a classic profile lauded as the summit where taste and value converge.

Name: La Aroma de Cuba Pasión Robusto
Description:
La Aroma de Cuba Pasión Robusto

  • Size: 5 1/2 x 50
  • Strength: Medium-Full
Award-winning father-and-son cigar-makers Pepin and Jaime Garcia blend a masterful Nicaraguan Puro from the finest premium tobaccos grown on family estates in Estelí, Jalapa, and Namanji. The 94-rated Pasión boasts a stunning Shade Grown wrapper harvested on select fields in Namanji, where tobacco plants thrive in a unique microclimate. The Garcias recognized the region’s untapped potential more than a decade ago. Warm days, cool nights, and fertile black soils produce tobaccos of exceptional flavor, quality, and aroma. Today, over one-third of the private 300-acre estate is dedicated to Shade Grown wrapper on plots shielded from direct sunlight and nourished by the basin’s snaking river. Profound notes of smoked cashew, leather, cedar, and molasses layer the palate with an extravagant spice. Explore a shining specimen of Garcia family terroir guided by their unwavering dedication to growing, aging, and blending the finest tobaccos in the world. Boxes of 24 cigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Tags: La Aroma de Cuba, Medium-Full, nicaragua, Pasión, Robusto

Name: My Father Flor de Las Antillas Toro Gordo Maduro
Short description: It produces a beautiful white ash giving it a great finish. This cigar has given the company its largest recognition.
Description:
My Father Flor de Las Antillas Toro Gordo Maduro

  • Size: 6 1/2 x 56
  • Strength: Medium-Full
Originally released in 2012, the Flor de las Antillas was named after Cuba; the largest and most beautiful of the Greater Antilles islands. With artwork from the early 1900's, the Garcia family once again honors THE ISLAND / THEIR BIRTHPLACE with this latest creation. This 3/4 to Full-Bodied blend is a perfect combination of Ecuadorian wrapper with Nicaraguan binders and fillers. The Habano sun grown Oscuro wrapper and the gentle box pressing give the cigar complexity and balance. The filler is a combination of tobaccos harvested from farms in La Estrella, La Bonita 1 and Las Marias, owned and operated by the Garcia Family. This cigar has an ideal combination of strength EXQUISITENESS / ELEGANCE / DELICACY, with notes of creamy leather and a sweet and salty finish that resounds on the palate, producing a beautiful white ash giving it a great finish. Cuba is the largest of the Greater Antilles islands. Because of its beauty it has earned the name "Flor de las Antillas". In its honor, the Garcia family has decided to put that name on this amazing and unique creation, combining a great cigar with a design that includes accents from the original art created in the early 1900's, packed in a box of 10 cigars. Box-Pressed in a sun grown wrapper harvested in Las Marias farm, located in the region of Namaja­ in Estela­, Nicaragua, owned and operated by the Garcia Family. This cigar is blended with several Cuban tobacco seeds, making it smooth and creamy. It starts with the signature My Father spice and has a rich cocoa flavor. It produces a beautiful white ash giving it a great finish. This cigar has given the company its largest recognition.

About My Father Cigars

One of the most exquisite and amazing Full-Bodied cigars you have ever tasted. The brand, named “My Father”, is made from specially selected tobacco grown at our own farms in Esteli, Nicaragua by My Father Cigars, S.A. The cigars are manufactured under the strictest supervision and consist of the best Habano-Rosado wrapper for an excellent taste. “My Father” is the highest scored and the most prestigious brand of the company. It has an average rating of 93 points, with two “94 Points” in Cigar Aficionado Magazine and has been included for two consecutive years in the Top 25 Best Cigars of the Year. Its elegant packaging consists of 23 cigars in a glossy dark brown box with a unique and high-level presentation. Boxes of 20 cigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars
Tags: Habano sun grown Oscuro wrapper, Maduro, Medium-Full, My Father, my father flor de las antillas, nicaragua, Toro Gordo

Name: Rocky Patel Conviction
Description:
Rocky Patel Conviction

  • Size: 6 1/2 x 52
  • Strength: Medium-Full

The Legacy Continues

The Conviction blend is a testament to our mastery in creating cigars that are rich in complexity and refinement. Meticulously crafted in our Nicaraguan Factory by our elite and seasoned rollers, ensuring that every draw is nothing short of exceptional. Limited to just 500 cigars per day, this small-batch cigar is a rare find that offers a smoking experience like no other.

The Age

Every aspect of Conviction has been meticulously crafted, the filler is comprised of some of our oldest tobaccos having used bales from our 2014 crop in Nicaragua. The result is a cigar that unfurls a tapestry of complexity, evolving with each delicate puff.

The Wrapper

Conviction’s wrapper is a testament to the legendary Terciario Cuban method, meticulously crafted from the oldest and oiliest San Andrés tobacco. This intricate fermentation process unleashes the full potential of the wrapper, resulting in an unforgettable smoking experience that is simply unparalleled.

The Rollers

In pursuit of perfection, only the top four master rollers in the factory have been entrusted with the Conviction. Working in pairs, each set of these master rollers is limited to rolling 250 cigars per day, resulting in a total of only 500 Conviction Cigars being rolled daily. This deliberate restriction ensures that each cigar receives the utmost attention and care, as the artisans dedicate their expertise and craftsmanship to creating a limited quantity of exceptional cigars.

The Rarity

With only four rollers dedicated to this project and the scarcity of the extraordinary tobacco used, Rocky has chosen to release a mere 5,000 boxes, rendering this cigar a truly unique and sought-after gem.

The Taste

Immerse yourself in the opulence and decadence of this medium-plus blend, where notes of caramel, honey, coffee, espresso, and chocolate intertwine harmoniously. Each draw of this boxed-pressed cigar is enriched by a lingering spice, captivating the senses, and offering a multifaceted experience that exemplifies Rocky Patel’s unwavering commitment to delivering unparalleled excellence. Boxes of 10 cigars
Tags: Conviction, Medium-Full, nicaragua, Rocky Patel, toro

Name: Cohiba Siglo de Oro - Year of the Rabbit
Description:
Cohiba Siglo de Oro - Year of the Rabbit

  • Size: 4 1/2 x 54
  • Strength: Medium-Full
"Siglo de Oro" under Cohiba is the vitola selected by Habanos, S.A. in 2023 to celebrate the occasion of the Chinese Lunar New Year and the Spring Festival. The brand chosen to commemorate the "Year of the Rabbit" according to the Chinese Lunar calendar, has been Cohiba, the most prestigious brand in the Habanos world. The name of the vitola "Siglo de Oro" pays tribute to the 30th anniversary of the Linea 1492, one of the most succeeded Lines into the brand. These Siglo de Oro under Cohiba brand are produced in exclusive and in limited quantities. This product is presented in a special box with 18 Habanos made "Totalmente a mano con Tripa Larga" - Totally handmade with Long Filler - after a careful selection of the wrapper, filler and binder leaves coming from the most prestigious zone, Vuelta Abajo, in the region of Pinar del Rio, Cuba.

The Punch Triunfos is a Cuban cigar that is part of the Línea Retro line. Handmade in Cuba, these cigars come in a retro-inspired aluminum tin of five cigars. The blend of tobacco leaves are from the Vuelta Abajo area of Pinar del Río.

Description:
Romeo y Julieta Cupido LCDH

  • Size: 5 5/6 x 55
  • Strength: Medium
Experience love at first smoke with Romeo y Julieta Cupido LCDH. This exclusive vitola (named Veronas) boasts a thick ring gauge and a figurado format, showcasing Romeo y Julieta's legendary aroma, balance, and complexity. Handmade with long filler from the world's best tobacco in the Vuelta Abajo region of Cuba, these torpedos from LCDH series are sure to be extremely sought after amongst aficionados. Every puff offers a medium-strength flavour profile with tobacco, spices, and wood notes.

Name: Rocky Patel Seed to Smoke Shade Toro
Description:
Rocky Patel Seed to Smoke Shade Toro

  • Size: 6 x 52
  • Strength: Mild-Medium
Rocky Patel Seed to Smoke Shade is a new bundle brand Cuban Sandwich-style cigar. You may be thinking what is a Cuban-style cigar, well it has a whole-leaf wrapper and binder like a traditional premium cigar but uses short fillers which are cuts of tobacco that are created while bunching other cigars. The Shade blend features a Connecticut-seed Honduran wrapper over a Honduran binder and a blend of short fillers from Honduras and Nicaragua. Its smooth profile is loaded with tones of cedar, coffee, cream, and subtle spices. Bundles of 10 cigars

Name: Cohiba Siglo I Tubos
Short description: Made using the traditional Tripa Larga, Totalmente a Mano -  long filler, totally hand made - technique.
Description:
Cohiba Siglo I Tubos

  • Size: 4 x 40
  • Strength: Medium
Part of Cohiba's Linea 1492 that commemorated the 500th Anniversary  of Columbus's arrival in Cuba.  The leaves for Cohibas are the "selection of the selection" from the 5 finest Vegas de Primera (first class fields) in the Vuelta Abajo region.   These leaves undergo an additional fermentation in barrels.  This unique process produces a special aroma and flavour you will only find in a Cohiba.   Made using the traditional Tripa Larga, Totalmente a Mano -  long filler, totally hand made - technique.

About Cohiba Cigars

Cohiba is made from the “selection of the selection” of the best leaves of the tobacco plantations of San Juan y Martínez * (D.O.P) y San Luis * (D.O.P) areas in the Vuelta Abajo * (D.O.P) zone, the additional fermentation of the “ Seco ” and “ Ligero ” leaves provide unique aroma and flavour. Cohiba is the Habanos flagship.

Tags: Cohiba, cohiba siglo, Cuba, Medium, Petit Corona, tubos

Description:
La Gloria Cubana Maduro Corona Gorda

  • Size: 6 x 52
  • Strength: Medium

About La Gloria Cubana Classic Maduro

La Gloria Cubana Classic Maduro adds a touch of darkness to our beloved Classic. Staying true to our original blend, the Maduro contains Dominican and Nicaraguan fillers and a Nicaraguan binder, but the key difference lies in the deep brown Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper. Masterfully crafted to deliver a rich, smooth flavour, Classic Maduro offers a timeless smoking experience that’s been savoured for generations. Boxes of 25 cigars

Name: La Gloria Cubana Natural Corona Gorda
Description:
La Gloria Cubana Natural Corona Gorda

  • Size: 6 x 52
  • Strength: Medium
This was the cigar that started it all for La Gloria Cubana. After being featured in one of the first issues of Cigar Aficionado, the La Gloria Cubana name became synonymous with boutique cigar excellence. La Gloria Cubana Classic is the smoke of choice for cigar lovers who desire full, rich flavour with notes of molasses, earth, and citrus. Our artisans start with a beautifully aged Ecuadorian Sumatra wrapper, then add an exquisite blend of Dominican and Nicaraguan tobaccos, and finish it off with a Nicaraguan binder to deliver a medium-bodied smoking experience unlike any other.
Boxes of 25 cigars

Name: La Gloria Cubana Serie R Maduro No. 6
Description:
La Gloria Cubana Serie R Maduro No. 6

  • Size: 5 7/8 x 60
  • Strength: Medium-Full
A medium to full-bodied smoke with notes of coffee, chocolate and spice.

About La Gloria Cubana Serie R Maduro

La Gloria Cubana Serie R is one of El Credito Cigar Factory's most favourable offerings. Serie R Maduro delivers a powerful yet refined smoking experience that draws from a proprietary blend of Dominican and Nicaraguan long filler tobaccos sheathed in a Nicaraguan binder. But the key difference with the Maduro lies in its dark Connecticut Broadleaf Maduro wrapper, which brings extra spice and depth to your palate. Notes of earth, spice, wood, and floral unfold from this full-bodied masterpiece. Boxes of 24 cigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

Name: La Gloria Cubana Serie S Robusto Gordo
Description:
La Gloria Cubana Serie S Robusto Gordo

  • Size: 5 1/2 x 56
  • Strength: Medium-Full
A medium-to-full-bodied smoke with notes of sweetness, earthiness, and light spice.
About La Gloria Cubana Serie S
La Gloria Cubana Serie S combines the stellar smoking performance and the substantial ring gauges that made the brand famous with –– for the first time –– an exquisite Mexican San Andrés wrapper. Grown in the potassium-rich, volcanic soil of the Veracruz region, Serie S’ San Andrés wrapper adds distinctive flavor to the robust binder and filler tobaccos beneath. Fans of La Gloria Cubana will immediately recognize the superior craftsmanship and smoking experience. But they will also note unique flavors driven by an expertly-blended smoke. Serie S is a full-time release set to become an instant classic, featuring hints of subtle earthiness, mild sweetness, and a touch of spice.
Boxes of 24 cigars
Categories: Cigars, New Arrivals, Cigars > Non-Cuban Cigars

The PERDOMO 20th Anniversary Maduro has decadent 8-year old Cuban-seed Nicaraguan Maduro wrappers that are bourbon barrel-aged for an additional 14 months to ensure the rich, sweet flavors pair perfectly with the higher-priming Cuban-seed Nicaraguan binder and filler blend that offers a balance of semi-sweet notes of chocolate and espresso on the finish.
